title: ‘Gay baboon rapes men in African village’ story just money-making ‘hogwash’
subtitle: In April 2017,
author: africacheck.org

with a headline: “African village terrorised by a gay baboon who recently raped 5 men”.

The story claimed a baboon named Somizi had attacked “more than six men” in an unnamed “African village”.

The story popped up again on

The original story, meant to be a joke, was then picked up by several other sites, many of them false news sites.

Snopes has rated it as false.

‘Satire’ and ‘hogwash’ earn the most money

interviewed the journalist behind the South Africa Morning Post, in an article headlined

The man, who wanted to remain anonymous, said:

“There aren’t that many people interested in politics. I can earn a few hundred dollars a month from my news site, it performs so badly.

“But stuff about gay baboons, stuff about pastors saying they went to heaven, that goes viral.”

The journalist does take care to label his made-up stories as “satire”. While some are real satire, others he describes as “hogwash”.

“Take one, from April this year: ‘Gay baboon terrorises villages, rapes 5 men’.”
